CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new series of PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers containing two different electron - deficient units ( DPP and TPD ) were synthesized to produce polymers with complementary and broad light absorption from 400 to 900 nm.

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDTT-DPP: This is a type of terpolymer where PBDTT is the backbone and DPP are two different electron-deficient units. So, "PBDTT" is the material name and "DPP" is also a material name.

2. DPP: This is one of the electron-deficient units in the terpolymer.

3. TPD: This is the other electron-deficient unit in the terpolymer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

The following entities clearly refer to Material Names in the paragraph:

1. PBDTT
2. DPP
3. TPD

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new series of PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers containing two different electron - deficient units ( DPP and TPD ) were synthesized to produce polymers with complementary and broad light absorption from 400 to 900 nm.

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDTT-DPP-TPD: This is a compound name, consisting of three parts: PBDTT (likely a type of polymer or abbreviation), DPP (an electron-deficient unit), and TPD (another electron-deficient unit).
2. DPP: This is an abbreviation for an electron-deficient unit.
3. TPD: This is an abbreviation for another electron-deficient unit.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PBDTT-DPP-TPD: This is a type of random terpolymer with the property of containing two different electron-deficient units (DPP and TPD).
2. Electron-deficient units: These are properties of the PBDTT-DPP-TPD terpolymer, specifically the DPP and TPD units.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PBDTT-DPP-TPD (type of random terpolymer containing two different electron-deficient units: DPP and TPD) |
| Electron-deficient units (properties of the PBDTT-DPP-TPD terpolymer, specifically the DPP and TPD units) |
| DPP (an electron-deficient unit) |
| TPD (another electron-deficient unit) |

Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new series of PBDTT-DPP-TPD random terpolymers containing two different electron - deficient units ( DPP and TPD ) were synthesized to produce polymers with complementary and broad light absorption from 400 to 900 nm.

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDTT-DPP-TPD: This is a type of random terpolymer. The property value here is the specific name of the terpolymer.
2. Two different electron-deficient units: The property values are DPP and TPD, which are the specific electron-deficient units in the terpolymer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PBDTT-DPP-TPD: This is a type of random terpolymer with the property of being a specific material.
2. 400 to 900 nm: This is a range of light absorption, which is a material property.
